Entries.default:
Hazanui Karū approaches, her weapon drawn. Her face is bruised and cut and her uniform torn from the rough journey, but her eyes are clear and focused.

On you.
[Attack] "Enough of this."
"Here's a sight I never thought I'd see. A trencher turning his back on his own people."
Entries.female: "Here's a sight I never thought I'd see. A trencher turning her back on her own people."

Entries.default:
"Your people couldn't hold Ukaizo before. And mine suffer for it.

"What makes you think you can take it now?"

"What you people from lush, bright lands fail to grasp is that Rauatai isn't a storm-tossed spit of land.

"It's the kith who stand together there."
"What did it cost for you to sell out your homeland?"
"Two, in fact." Her furious gaze flickers to Maia.

"All due respect, boss - me being here has got nothing to do with the cause.

"I still believe, but... there's more at stake." 

Maia shifts her gaze over to you.
"Ukaizo belongs to the Huana."
"The Vailians will accomplish great things here."
"You think Rauatai's known hardship? The Príncipi have thrived with no homeland. Ukaizo shall be theirs."
"I answer to no one."
"The ranga nui fed your family from his own table. Rauatai's finest warriors taught you to shoot."

"And this is how you use your gifts." 

She shakes her head before turning back to you.

"Captain... Watcher. There's a right and a wrong about this, drawn as clearly as a line in the sand.

"I know what side I'm on." 

She grips her weapon and stares you down. Ishiza glances between you, seeming less certain.
"Ukaizo belongs to us. We've earned it with blood and sweat."
"And no one shall take it from us now."
"Or so I thought." She turns an accusing gaze on Maia.

"What everyone else fails to grasp is that Rauatai isn't a storm-tossed spit of land.

"It's the kith who stand together there."
"Not while I'm around."
"Rauataians! Defend Ukaizo!"
"Then die a traitor."
"Then die alone, Watcher."
"I don't want to fight you."
"This is greater than the two of us, Watcher."
"Why are we arguing about this when Eothas is destroying the cycle?"

"I can't stop him. Neither can you.

"But I can give my country a chance at weathering what comes next."
